column4: Is it normal for your system to tell you that you're running out of disk space when using an encrypted (DM Crypt) LVM  file system   and knowing the facts you've never used much disk space?
pastebin the output of df-h
http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=i02UCyXH
that tells me that you're using ~ 100% of your LVM.
113 GB of 119 GB used.
I'm aware.  You're using almost 100% of it
I would doubt it.
Alrighties, I'll just wait until the system says it's using up all disk space and wait to see if this is really accurate or not,.
you can do a du -sh / to get the real number
Lol, permission is denied, even with sudo.
then you really are using 112 G on /
I do not understand if this will lead to consequences                 OR     what could be eating up the space on my SSD.
I'd imagine you have downloaded a lot of stuff, movies, music etc?
Nothing, I don't do much on this machine.       Installed a few apps, but they are not even 30GBs worth.
I think I found the file on my system creating problems.         /proc/kcore     <---- 140.7 TB (140,737,486,266,368 bytes)                 I only have a 128GB SSD (which is really a 119GB).
what is the output of du -sh /home/
you might need to restart to make the file actually be removed.
since it's probably open with X
want a quick hack to make that file not writeable?
Permissions? :P
or chattr +i
